result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas C Lara was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 3 days of sentence credit if probation becomes revoked.

miscConds.notes:
-Domestic Violence Assessment
-No Violent Contact with Iylish C.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
1:48 p.m. Attorney Joey Roeth in court.  Lisa Mary Vanden Branden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.

COURT finds defendant guilty 2016CM122. Sentence withheld. Orders 1 year probation with domestic violence assessment, no violent contcat with Iylish C, court costs, and DNA sample. 3 days jail credit if probation is revoked.

2014CM144 COURT dismisses counts 2 and 3 but reads in. COURT finds defendant guilty on count 1. Sentence withheld. Orders 1 year probation with domestic violence assessment, no violent contcat with Iylish C, court costs, and DNA sample. 16 days jail credit if probation is revoked.

Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Court adjourned 1:56 p.m.

Statement by Atty Privat - victim is present in court and requests the no contact provision be changed, requests to have contact with the defendant.  Statement by ADA - objects to the request.  Court questions victim regarding the Christine Ann Center.  Defendant concurs, will meet with someone there. 2:06 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Iylish C.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
